attribute.name: CURRENT_GMT_TIME
attribute.description: The attribute will be assigned current time value during evaluation

attribute.name: CURRENT_GMT_DATE
attribute.description: The attribute will be assigned current date value during evaluation

attribute.name: CURRENT_GMT_DATETIME
attribute.description: The attribute will be assigned current datetime value during evaluation

attribute.name: SYS_SUBJECTGROUPS
attribute.description: List of unqualified group names to which user belongs: ["admin", "managers"]

attribute.name: SYS_SUBJECTROLES
attribute.description: List of unqualified role names granted to user for current request

attribute.name: SYS_APP
attribute.description: Unqualified name of the binding resource for the resource on which the query is performed: admin

attribute.name: SYS_OBJ_TYPE
attribute.description: ResourceType on which the query is performed: LibraryResourceType

attribute.name: SYS_OBJ
attribute.description: Resource on which the query is performed: bar

attribute.name: SYS_OBJ_Q
attribute.description: Full qualified resource name on which the query is performed: /foo/bar

attribute.name: SYS_PRIVILEGE
attribute.description: Unqualified name of the action on which the resource is being queried.

attribute.name: CURRENT_DATETIME
attribute.description: This attribute indicates the current date and time at the PDP. In practice, it is the date and time at which authorization decision for the request is calculated.

function.name: DNS_NAME_IS_IN
function.description: This function takes two arguments. The first one is of type OpssDNSName, the second one is a bag of type OpssDNSName. This function returns true if the value of first argument in present in the bag represented by the second argument.

function.name: ANY_URI_AT_LEAST_ONE_MEMBER_OF
function.description: This function returns True if and only if at least one element of the first argument is contained in the second argument

function.name: YEAR_MONTH_DURATION_BAG_SIZE
function.description: This function returns the size of the input bag.

function.name: BASE64_BINARY_AT_LEAST_ONE_MEMBER_OF
function.description: This function returns True if and only if at least one element of the first argument is contained in the second argument

function.name: RFC822_NAME_EQUAL
function.description: This function takes two arguments of type OpssRFC822Name and returns an OpssBoolean. The function returns True if and only if the arguments are equal. Otherwise, it returns False.

function.name: TIME_BAG
function.description: time_bag

function.name: INTEGER_SET_EQUALS
function.description: This function return True if any only if first argument is a subset of second argument AND second argument is a subset of first argument.

function.name: DATE_TIME_SUBTRACT_DAYTIME_DURATION
function.description: This function will subtract second argument from the first one and return the result as OpssDateTime

function.name: DOUBLE_MULTIPLY
function.description: This functions takes two or more arguments of type OpssDouble and returns their product.

function.name: NOT
function.description: This function returns True if its arguments evaluates to False, otherwise, it returns False

function.name: TIME_IS_IN
function.description: This function takes two arguments. The first one is of type OpssTime, the second one is a bag of type OpssTime. This function returns true if the value of first argument in present in the bag represented by the second argument.

function.name: ANY_URI_SET_EQUALS
function.description: This function return True if any only if first argument is a subset of second argument AND second argument is a subset of first argument.

function.name: DATE_TIME_ADD_YEARMONTH_DURATION
function.description: This function will add its two arguments and return the result as OpssDateTime

function.name: ALL_OF
function.description: This function applies a Boolean function between specific primitive values and a bag of values, and SHALL return True if and only if the predicate is True for at least one element of the bag. It takes n+1 arguments, where n is one or greater. The first argument names a Boolean function that takes n arguments of primitive types. Under the remaining n arguments, n-1 parameters are values of primitive data-types and one is a bag of a primitive data-type. The expression is evaluated as if the function named in the first argument is applied to the n-1 non-bag arguments and each element of the bag argument and the results are combined with an AND

function.name: STRING_FROM_ANY_URI
function.description: This function will convert its argument to a string value.

function.name: DOUBLE_ONE_AND_ONLY
function.description: This function returns value in the bag if bag contains only one value. Otherwise its result is Indeterminate

function.name: STRING_BAG_SIZE
function.description: This function returns the size of the input bag.

function.name: TIME_SET_EQUALS
function.description: This function return True if any only if first argument is a subset of second argument AND second argument is a subset of first argument.

function.name: DAY_TIME_DURATION_SUBSET
function.description: This function will return True if and only if the first argument is a subset of the second argument

function.name: STRING_IS_IN
function.description: This function takes two arguments. The first one is of type OpssString, the second one is a bag of type OpssString. This function returns true if the value of first argument in present in the bag represented by the second argument.

function.name: DNS_NAME_REGEXP_MATCH
function.description: This function takes two arguments. The first is of type OpssString and represents a regular expression. The second argument is of type OpssDNSName. This function returns true if the string value of the second argument matches the regular expression.

function.name: VALID_UNTIL_TIME
function.description: This function keeps the decision cache valid until the time specified by first argument.

function.name: HEX_BINARY_ONE_AND_ONLY
function.description: This function returns value in the bag if bag contains only one value. Otherwise its result is Indeterminate

function.description: This function will convert the value of OpssString argument to OpssBoolean

function.name: DATE_TIME_INTERSECTION
function.description: This function returns an intersection of its two arguments

function.name: BASE64_BINARY_IS_IN

function.name: RFC822_NAME_MATCH
function.description: This function takes two arguments, first is of type string and second is of type rfc822Name. It returns true if and only if the first argument's local part - if any - matches the second argument by case-sensitive matching and/ or its domain part - if any - matches domain part of second argument by case-insensitive domain matching.

function.name: ANY_OF_ANY
function.description: This function applies a Boolean function on each tuple from the cross product on all bags arguments, and returns True if and only if the predicate is True for at least one inside-function call. This function takes n+1 arguments, where n is one or greater. The first argument is a <Function> element that names a Boolean function that takes n arguments. The remaining arguments are either primitive data types or bags of primitive types. The expression is evaluated as if the function named in the first argument was applied between every tuple of the cross product on all bags and the primitive values, and the results were combined using OR. The semantics are that the result of the expression will be True if and only if the applied predicate is True for at least one function call on the tuples from the bags and primitive values.

function.name: N_OF
function.description: The first argument to this function must be an OpssInteger. Remaining arguments must be of type OpssBoolean. The first argument specifies the minimum number of the remaining arguments that MUST evaluate to True for the function to evaluate to True. If the first argument is 0, the result is True. If the number of arguments after the first one is less than the value of the first argument, then the function result will be Indeterminate.

function.description: This function returns the largest (closest to positive infinity) double value that is not greater than the argument and is equal to a mathematical integer.

function.name: ANY_OF_ALL
function.description: This function applies a Boolean function between the elements of two bags. The expression will be True if and only if the supplied predicate is True between each element of the second bag and any element of the first bag. This function takes three arguments. The first argument is a <Function> element that names a Boolean function that takes two arguments of primitive types. The second argument is a bag of a primitive data-type. The third argument is a bag of a primitive data-type. The expression is evaluated as if the ANY_OF function had been applied to each value of the second bag and the whole of the first bag using the supplied function, and the results were then combined using AND

function.name: DATE_TIME_SET_EQUALS
function.description: This function return True if any only if first argument is a subset of second argument AND second argument is a subset of first argument.

function.name: DATE_TIME_SUBTRACT_YEARMONTH_DURATION
function.description: This function will subtract second argument from the first one and return the result as OpssDateTime

function.name: INTEGER_LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL
function.description: This function takes two arguments of type OpssInteger and returns an OpssBoolean. It returns True if the value of the first parameter is less than or equal to the second.

function.name: BASE64_BINARY_ONE_AND_ONLY
function.description: This function returns value in the bag if bag contains only one value. Otherwise its result is Indeterminate

function.name: OR
function.description: This function returns True if any of its arguments evaluates to True, otherwise, it returns false.

function.name: RFC822_NAME_SUBSET
function.description: This function will return True if and only if the first argument is a subset of the second argument

function.name: ROUND
function.description: This function takes one argument of type double and returns the closest integer values.

function.name: X500_NAME_EQUAL
function.description: This function takes two arguments of type OpssX500Name and returns an OpssBoolean. The function returns True if and only if the arguments are equal. Otherwise, it returns False.

function.name: INTEGER_ADD
function.description: This function takes two or more arguments of type integer and returns their sum.

function.name: DATE_SET_EQUALS
function.description: This function return True if any only if first argument is a subset of second argument AND second argument is a subset of first argument.

function.name: TIME_LESS_THAN
function.description: This function takes two arguments of type OpssTime and returns an OpssBoolean. It returns True if the value of the first parameter is less than that of second.

function.name: STRING_GREATER_THAN
function.description: This function takes two arguments of type OpssString and returns an OpssBoolean. It returns True if the value of the first parameter is greater than that of second.

function.name: DOUBLE_SET_EQUALS
function.description: This function return True if any only if first argument is a subset of second argument AND second argument is a subset of first argument.

function.name: BASE64_BINARY_SUBSET
function.description: This function will return True if and only if the first argument is a subset of the second argument

function.name: BOOLEAN_UNION
function.description: This function will return the union of all its input arguments

function.name: RFC822_NAME_REGEXP_MATCH
function.description: This function takes two arguments. The first is of type OpssString and represents a regular expression. The second argument is of type OpssRFC822Name. This function returns true if the string value of the second argument matches the regular expression.

function.name: DATE_INTERSECTION
function.description: This function returns an intersection of its two arguments

function.name: INTEGER_MULTIPLY
function.description: This functions takes two or more arguments of type OpssInteger and returns their product.

function.name: TIME_GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL
function.description: This function takes two arguments of type OpssTime and returns an OpssBoolean. It returns True if the value of the first parameter is greater than or equal to the second.

function.name: IP_ADDRESS_ONE_AND_ONLY
function.description: This function returns value in the bag if bag contains only one value. Otherwise its result is Indeterminate

function.name: STRING_FROM_DATE
function.description: This function will convert its argument to a string value.

function.name: ANY_URI_SUBSET
function.description: This function will return True if and only if the first argument is a subset of the second argument

function.name: ANY_URI_ONE_AND_ONLY
function.description: This function returns value in the bag if bag contains only one value. Otherwise its result is Indeterminate

function.name: DATE_TIME_ADD_DAYTIME_DURATION
function.description: This function will add its two arguments and return the result as OpssDateTime

function.name: INTEGER_EQUAL
function.description: This function takes two arguments of type OpssInteger and returns an OpssBoolean. The function returns True if and only if the arguments are equal. Otherwise, it returns False.

function.name: RFC822_NAME_BAG_SIZE
function.description: This function returns the size of the input bag.

function.name: ANY_URI_CONTAINS
function.description: This function returns True if string format of second argument contains the firt argument.

function.name: STRING_SET_EQUALS
function.description: This function return True if any only if first argument is a subset of second argument AND second argument is a subset of first argument.

function.name: INTEGER_IS_IN
function.description: This function takes two arguments. The first one is of type OpssInteger, the second one is a bag of type OpssInteger. This function returns true if the value of first argument in present in the bag represented by the second argument.

function.name: STRING_BAG
function.description: string_bag

function.name: DOUBLE_UNION
function.description: This function will return the union of all its input arguments

function.name: X500_NAME_BAG
function.description: x500Name_bag

function.name: AND
function.description: This function returns True if and only all its arguments evaluate to True, otherwise, it returns False.

function.name: TIME_BAG_SIZE
function.description: This function returns the size of the input bag.

function.name: INTEGER_BAG
function.description: integer_bag

function.name: STRING_FROM_TIME
function.description: This function will convert its argument to a string value.

function.name: DATE_TIME_ONE_AND_ONLY
function.description: This function returns value in the bag if bag contains only one value. Otherwise its result is Indeterminate

function.name: ANY_OF
function.description: This function applies a Boolean function between specific primitive values and a bag of values, and SHALL return True if and only if the predicate is True for at least one element of the bag. It takes n+1 arguments, where n is one or greater. The first argument names a Boolean function that takes n arguments of primitive types. Under the remaining n arguments, n-1 parameters are values of primitive data-types and one is a bag of a primitive data-type. The expression is evaluated as if the function named in the first argument is applied to the n-1 non-bag arguments and each element of the bag argument and the results are combined with an OR.

function.name: X500_NAME_FROM_STRING
function.description: This function will convert the value of OpssString argument to OpssX500Name

function.name: DATE_AT_LEAST_ONE_MEMBER_OF
function.description: This function returns True if and only if at least one element of the first argument is contained in the second argument

function.name: HEX_BINARY_BAG
function.description: hexBinary_bag

function.name: YEAR_MONTH_DURATION_EQUAL
function.description: This function takes two arguments of type OpssYearMonthDuration and returns an OpssBoolean. The function returns True if and only if the arguments are equal. Otherwise, it returns False.

function.name: ALL_OF_ANY
function.description: This function applies a Boolean function between the elements of two bags. The expression will be True if and only if the supplied predicate is True between each element of the first bag and any element of the second bag. This function takes three arguments. The first argument is a <Function> element that names a Boolean function that takes two arguments of primitive types. The second argument is a bag of a primitive data-type. The third argument is a bag of a primitive data-type. The expression is evaluated as if the ANY_OF function had been applied to each value of the first bag and the whole of the second bag using the supplied function, and the results were then combined using AND

function.name: STRING_CONCATENATE
function.description: This function concatenates two or more OpssString arguments and returns result.

function.name: BOOLEAN_SUBSET
function.description: This function will return True if and only if the first argument is a subset of the second argument

function.name: X500_NAME_MATCH
function.description: This function takes two arguments of type x500Name. It returns true if and only if the first argument matches some terminal sequence of RDNs from the second argument, when compared using x500_name_equal function.

function.name: DAY_TIME_DURATION_FROM_STRING
function.description: This function will convert the value of OpssString argument to OpssDayTimeDuration

function.name: HEX_BINARY_EQUAL
function.description: This function takes two arguments of type OpssHexBinary and returns an OpssBoolean. The function returns True if and only if the arguments are equal. Otherwise, it returns False.

function.name: STRING_FROM_RFC822_NAME
function.description: This function will convert its argument to a string value.

function.name: X500_NAME_ONE_AND_ONLY
function.description: This function returns value in the bag if bag contains only one value. Otherwise its result is Indeterminate

function.name: RF822_NAME_FROM_STRING
function.description: Deprecated. Use RFC822_NAME_FROM_STRING function instead. This function will convert the value of OpssString argument to OpssRFC822Name

function.name: RFC822_NAME_FROM_STRING
function.description: This function will convert the value of OpssString argument to OpssRFC822Name

function.name: VALID_FOR_SECONDS
function.description: This function keeps the decision cache valid for the number of seconds specified by first argument.

function.name: DATE_TIME_UNION
function.description: This function will return the union of all its input arguments

function.name: TIME_AT_LEAST_ONE_MEMBER_OF
function.description: This function returns True if and only if at least one element of the first argument is contained in the second argument

function.name: DATE_TIME_EQUAL
function.description: This function takes two arguments of type OpssDateTime and returns an OpssBoolean. The function returns True if and only if the arguments are equal. Otherwise, it returns False.

function.name: ATTRIBUTE_HAS_VALUE
function.description: This function takes an attribute name as argument. It returns True if the attribute has been assigned a value.

function.name: STRING_SUBSET
function.description: This function will return True if and only if the first argument is a subset of the second argument

function.name: BOOLEAN_INTERSECTION
function.description: This function returns an intersection of its two arguments

function.name: RFC822_NAME_ONE_AND_ONLY
function.description: This function returns value in the bag if bag contains only one value. Otherwise its result is Indeterminate

function.name: STRING_LESS_THAN
function.description: This function takes two arguments of type OpssString and returns an OpssBoolean. It returns True if the value of the first parameter is less than that of second.

function.name: TIME_INTERSECTION
function.description: This function returns an intersection of its two arguments

function.name: BASE64_BINARY_SET_EQUALS
function.description: This function return True if any only if first argument is a subset of second argument AND second argument is a subset of first argument.

function.name: TIME_EQUAL
function.description: This function takes two arguments of type OpssTime and returns an OpssBoolean. The function returns True if and only if the arguments are equal. Otherwise, it returns False.

function.name: VALID_UNTIL_DATE
function.description: This function keeps the decision cache valid until the date specified by first argument.

function.name: INTEGER_SUBSET
function.description: This function will return True if and only if the first argument is a subset of the second argument

function.name: ANY_URI_FROM_STRING
function.description: This function will convert the value of OpssString argument to OpssAnyURI

function.name: TIME_UNION
function.description: This function will return the union of all its input arguments

function.name: ALL_OF_ALL
function.description: This function applies a Boolean function between the elements of two bags. The expression will be True if and only if the supplied predicate is True between each and every element of the first bag collectively against all the elements of the second bag. This function takes three arguments. The first argument is a <Function> element that names a Boolean function that takes two arguments of primitive types. The second argument is a bag of a primitive data-type. The third argument is a bag of a primitive data-type. The expression is evaluated as if the function named in the first element were applied between every element of the second argument and every element of the third argument and the results were combined using AND. The semantics are that the result of the expression is True if and only if the applied predicate is True for all elements of the first bag compared to all the elements of the second bag.

function.name: DATE_TIME_AT_LEAST_ONE_MEMBER_OF
function.description: This function returns True if and only if at least one element of the first argument is contained in the second argument

function.name: DNS_NAME_ONE_AND_ONLY
function.description: This function returns value in the bag if bag contains only one value. Otherwise its result is Indeterminate

function.name: BASE64_BINARY_INTERSECTION
function.description: This function returns an intersection of its two arguments

function.name: HEX_BINARY_INTERSECTION
function.description: This function returns an intersection of its two arguments

function.name: DAY_TIME_DURATION_ONE_AND_ONLY
function.description: This function returns value in the bag if bag contains only one value. Otherwise its result is Indeterminate

function.name: DAY_TIME_DURATION_UNION
function.description: This function will return the union of all its input arguments

function.name: DATE_ONE_AND_ONLY
function.description: This function returns value in the bag if bag contains only one value. Otherwise its result is Indeterminate

function.name: STRING_FROM_DATE_TIME
function.description: This function will convert its argument to a string value.

function.name: HEX_BINARY_AT_LEAST_ONE_MEMBER_OF
function.description: This function returns True if and only if at least one element of the first argument is contained in the second argument

function.name: MAP
function.description: This function converts a bag of values to another bag of values. This function takes n+1 arguments, where n is one or greater. The first argument is a <Function> element naming a function that takes a n arguments of a primitive data-type and returns a value of a primitive data-type Under the remaining n arguments, n-1 parameters are values of primitive data-types and one is a bag of a primitive data-type. The expression is evaluated as if the function named in the first argument were applied to the n-1 non-bag arguments and each element of the bag argument and resulting in a bag of the converted value. The result is a bag of the primitive data-type that is returned by the function named in the first element.

function.name: IP_ADDRESS_BAG_SIZE
function.description: This function returns the size of the input bag.

function.name: DAY_TIME_DURATION_BAG_SIZE
function.description: This function returns the size of the input bag.

function.name: STRING_FROM_BOOLEAN
function.description: This function will convert its argument to a string value.

function.name: X500_NAME_SUBSET
function.description: This function will return True if and only if the first argument is a subset of the second argument

function.name: DOUBLE_SUBTRACT
function.description: This function takes two arguments of type OpssDouble, subtract the second argument from first and returns the result.

function.name: BOOLEAN_BAG_SIZE
function.display-name: This function returns the size of the input bag.
function.description: urn:oasis:names:tc:xacml:1.0:function:boolean-bag-size

function.name: STRING_FROM_DNS_NAME
function.description: This function will convert its argument to a string value.

function.name: STRING_SUBSTRING
function.description: This function returns a substring of string representation of first argument starting from position indicated by second argument and end at position indicated by third argument.

function.name: TIME_IN_RANGE
function.description: This function takes three arguments of type OpssTime and returns an OpssBoolean. It returns True if the first argument falls in the range defined inclusively by the second and third arguments. Otherwise, it returns false.

app-role.name: ApplicationPolicyAdmin
app-role.description: This role has Manage rights for a specific Application and any nested Policy Domain objects.
